div.div: σπλάγχνον : pl., inwards, the nobler parts of the animal, esp. heart, liver, and lungs. While other parts of the victim were burning on the altar, these were roasted and tasted preliminary to the sacrificial banquet, Il. 11.464, Od. 3.9.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
